item.title: Aldean add a quote by Henry M. Robert
item.description: "Where there is no law, but every man does what is right in his own eyes, there is the least of liberty." -- Henry M. Robert

item.title: Aldean add a quote by William Makepeace Thackeray
item.description: "To endure is greater than to dare; to tire out hostile fortune; to be daunted my no difficulty; to keep heart when all have lost it; to go through intrigue spotless; to forgo even ambition when the end is gained - who can say this is not greatness?" -- William Makepeace Thackeray

item.title: Aldean add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If the world is meaningless, then so are we; if we mean something, we do not mean alone." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Aldean add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Never invoke the gods unless you really want them to appear. It annoys them very much." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Aldean add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Aldean add a quote by Gene Fowler
item.description: "Writing is easy. You only need to stare at a blank piece of paper until drops of blood form on your forehead." -- Gene Fowler

item.title: Aldean add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "First we thought the PC was a calculator. Then we found out how to turn numbers into letters with ASCII â€” and we thought it was a typewriter. Then we discovered graphics, and we thought it was a television. With the World Wide Web, we've realized it's a brochure." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Aldean add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I think fish is nice, but then I think that rain is wet, so who am I to judge?" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Aldean add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "All of humanity's problems stem from man's inability to sit quietly in a room alone." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Aldean add a quote by Rudy Ratzinger
item.description: "It's only their words they speak, so speak with your own." -- Rudy Ratzinger

item.title: Aldean add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "How do I know what I think until I see what I say?" -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Aldean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Aldean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Aldean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Aldean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Fantasy is escapist, and that is its glory. If a soldier is imprisioned by the enemy, don't we consider it his duty to escape?. . .If we value the freedom of mind and soul, if we're partisans of liberty, then it's our plain duty to escape, and to take as many people with us as we can!" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Aldean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Aldean add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It is not our part to master all the tides of the world, but to do what is in us for the succour of those years wherein we are set, uprooting the evil in the fields that we know, so that those who live after may have clean earth to till. What weather they shall have is not ours to rule." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Aldean add a quote by Billy Collins
item.description: "The mind can be trained to relieve itself on paper." -- Billy Collins

item.title: Aldean add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Aldean add a quote by Glen Cook
item.description: "Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day." -- Glen Cook
